titleStmt.title: Higayon selah. Ierusalem fatall to her assailants. Discovered in a sermon before the Honorable House of commons August 29. 1649. At Margarets Westminster, upon their solemne day of thanksgiving for that signall victory over the Lord Ormond, in routing his whole army, and raising the seige of Dublin in Ireland, by the garrison thereof under the command of lieutenant Generall Jones. / By William Cooper M.A. minister of the gospel at Olaves Southwark.
titleStmt.author: Cooper, William, minister at St. Olave's Southwark.

titleStmt.title: Higayon selah. Ierusalem fatall to her assailants. Discovered in a sermon before the Honorable House of commons August 29. 1649. At Margarets Westminster, upon their solemne day of thanksgiving for that signall victory over the Lord Ormond, in routing his whole army, and raising the seige of Dublin in Ireland, by the garrison thereof under the command of lieutenant Generall Jones. / By William Cooper M.A. minister of the gospel at Olaves Southwark.
titleStmt.author: Cooper, William, minister at St. Olave's Southwark.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for the author, and are to be sold at the Crown in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: The first two words of the title are printed in Hebrew characters.
The verso of the fisrt leaf contains an order to print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: Cooper, William, minister at St. Olave's, Southwark.
